creator: jraymond@accelerantmobile.com
text:
The following successfully executes the first macro with the attribute 
of 'descriptn', but the second macro with the attribute 'description' fails 
with the error 'required attribute description not set'.

this should either be fixed, or documented that 'description' is an invalid 
attribute type.

<project default="test">

   <macrodef name="working.macro">
      <attribute name="descriptn"/>
      <sequential>
         <echo>descriptn=@{descriptn}</echo>
      </sequential>
   </macrodef>

   <macrodef name="broken.macro">
      <attribute name="description"/>
      <sequential>
         <echo>description=@{description}</echo>
      </sequential>
   </macrodef>

   <target name="test" description="Illustrate MacroDef 'description' 
attribute problem">
      <working.macro descriptn = "A descriptn" />
      <broken.macro description = "A description"/>
   </target>    
</project>

Should <.*def> tasks disallow any attribute that corresponds to a setter method 
available from oata.Task?
creator: mbenson@apache.org
peter.reilly@corvil.com
text:
Fixed in cvs, should be in ant 1.6.2.
Matt, currently tasks can override
description and other attributes of
task - so macrodef instances should be
able to do so as well.
Peter
